document_data.caption: A magical sacaanti.
document_data.name: Sacaanti
document_data.first: ''[[Ruins of Zhentil Keep|Ruins of Zhentil Keep: Monstrous Compendium]]''
document_data.mainbody: A '''sacaanti''' was a type of creature that came about as a result of [[magic]]al creation. It quite quite similar to an [[imp]] or a [[quasit]], appearing as an amalgamation of the two. They were made by [[wizard]]s of the [[Zhentarim]] to be utilized as [[familiar]]s.
document_data.Description:
Sacaanti very much resembled small [[fiend]]s. They had leathery, [[bat]]-like wings and their body was noticeably tailless. 

Unlike either of their progenitor species, Sacaanti were entirely devoted to their master-creators. Each pair of master and familiar enjoyed a strong telepathic link and emotional bond with one another. If either of them were to die, the other would be devastated.
document_data.Abilities: They possessed a number of innate powers such as ''[[regenerate|regeneration]]'', the ability to "become ethereal" whenever they chose, as well as the capability to perform spellcasting.
document_data.Combat: Sacaanti most readily attacked others using their claws or venomous bite. While they were known to cast [[spell]]s in battle, Sacaanti possessed a unique characteristic: their masters could cast spells through them, using their senses and position.
document_data.Ecology: In order to create a sacaanti, a [[mage]] needed to gather both an imp and a quasit in the same room. Several spells were involved in the creature's formation, including two castings of ''[[polymorph]]'' and a specifically-worded version of the ''[[wish]]'' spell.
document_data.History: The first specimens were created in Zhentarim laboratories some time during the 13{{th}} century [[DR]].
